creditline: The John R. Van Derlip Fund
description: panel or chalice veil, c.1600, silk satin with raised work embroidery of couched gold, seed pearls and beads; in the center the letters \'IHS\' with a bleeding heart and a cross surrounded by golden rays and the same letters in each corner; on each side \'MRA\' for the virgin in each case with a bleeding heart and a crown; framed by a wide border of vinelike stems enclosing Tudor roses, peapods and carnations; from the family of the Duke of Norfolk
medium: Silk, metallic threads, wire, beads, sequins; raised work embroidery, needle lace
title: Chalice Veil
